scripts.android:adb-reverse: adb reverse tcp:8081 tcp:8081 && adb reverse tcp:${EXAMPLE_API_PORT:-3003} tcp:${EXAMPLE_API_PORT:-3003} && adb forward tcp:5277 tcp:5277
scripts.android:clean: rm -rf android/.gradle && rm -rf android/build && rm -rf android/app/build && rm -rf android/app/.cxx
scripts.android:dhu: pkill -f 'desktop-head-unit' || true && echo '⚠️  If the DHU fails to connect, make sure you ran yarn android:adb-reverse and started the head unit server from your phone (Developer mode must be enabled in the Android Auto app). See: https://developer.android.com/training/cars/testing/dhu' && $HOME/Library/Android/sdk/extras/google/auto/desktop-head-unit
scripts.android:ide: sed -i '' '/^NODE_BINARY=/d' android/local.properties && echo "NODE_BINARY=$(which node)" >> android/local.properties && open -a /Applications/Android\ Studio.app android
scripts.android:install-release: RD=android/app/build/outputs/bundle/release && (rm $RD/app.apks || true) && bundletool build-apks --bundle=$RD/app-release.aab --output=$RD/app.apks && (adb uninstall com.example || true) && bundletool install-apks --apks=$RD/app.apks
scripts.android:release: cd android && ./gradlew clean && ./gradlew bundleRelease && cd app/build/outputs/bundle/release && pwd && ls
scripts.ios:rebuild: cd ios && pod install && cd .. && yarn ios
scripts.pod: bundle install && bundle exec pod install --project-directory=ios
